perturbation.original_text: 15.1 DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTIES. EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT, VERTICALNET HEREBY DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR STATUTORY, WITH RESPECT TO ANY AND ALL VERTICALNET DELIVERABLES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, TITLE AND NON-INFRINGEMENT.
perturbation.changed_text: 15.1 DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTIES. VERTICALNET HEREBY DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, WITH RESPECT TO ANY AND ALL VERTICALNET DELIVERABLES.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'STATUTORY, WITH RESPECT TO ANY AND ALL VERTICALNET DELIVERABLES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, TITLE AND NON-INFRINGEMENT' from the disclaimer, the clause now attempts to waive implied statutory warranties, including those related to the quality and fitness of the deliverables. This contradicts consumer protection laws like the implied warranty of merchantability, which ensures goods meet basic standards. This introduces legal risk by potentially violating consumer rights in Pennsylvania and other states, where such waivers may not be enforceable, especially if the deliverables are considered consumer goods.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Pennsylvania's Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) and similar consumer protection statutes in other states regarding implied warranties.

perturbation.original_text: 15.2 DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTIES. EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT, NEOFORMA HEREBY DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR STATUTORY, WITH RESPECT TO ANY AND ALL NEOFORMA DELIVERABLES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, TITLE AND NON-INFRINGEMENT.
perturbation.changed_text: 15.2 DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTIES. NEOFORMA HEREBY DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, WITH RESPECT TO ANY AND ALL NEOFORMA DELIVERABLES.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'STATUTORY, WITH RESPECT TO ANY AND ALL NEOFORMA DELIVERABLES, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, TITLE AND NON-INFRINGEMENT' from the disclaimer, the clause now attempts to waive implied statutory warranties, including those related to the quality and fitness of the deliverables. This contradicts consumer protection laws like the implied warranty of merchantability, which ensures goods meet basic standards. This introduces legal risk by potentially violating consumer rights in California and other states, where such waivers may not be enforceable, especially if the deliverables are considered consumer goods.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California's implied warranty laws and the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC).

perturbation.original_text: 15.3 LIMITATION OF LIABILITY. EXCEPT IN CONNECTION WITH A BREACH BY EITHER PARTY OF ARTICLE 13, THE INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS OF NEOFORMA UNDER SECTIONS 15.4(c) [INDEMNIFICATION BY NEOFORMA] AND (d) AND THE INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS OF VERTICALNET UNDER SECTION 15.5(c) [INDEMNIFICATION BY VERTICALNET] AND (d), NEITHER PARTY WILL BE LIABLE FOR ANY SPECIAL, INDIRECT, CONSEQUENTIAL, EXEMPLARY OR INCIDENTAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT, HOWEVER CAUSED AND UNDER ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), EVEN IF SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. EXCEPT IN CONNECTION WITH A BREACH BY EITHER PARTY OF ARTICLE 13, THE INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS OF NEOFORMA UNDER SECTION 15.4(c) [INDEMNIFICATION BY NEOFORMA] AND (d) AND THE INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS OF VERTICALNET UNDER SECTION 15.5(c) [INDEMNIFICATION BY VERTICALNET] AND (d), EACH PARTY'S LIABILITY FOR DAMAGES HEREUNDER SHALL NOT EXCEED $1,000,000.
perturbation.changed_text: 15.3 LIMITATION OF LIABILITY. NEITHER PARTY WILL BE LIABLE FOR ANY SPECIAL, INDIRECT, CONSEQUENTIAL, EXEMPLARY OR INCIDENTAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT, HOWEVER CAUSED AND UNDER ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), EVEN IF SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. EACH PARTY'S LIABILITY FOR DAMAGES HEREUNDER SHALL NOT EXCEED $1,000.
perturbation.explanation: The change drastically reduces the liability cap from $1,000,000 to $1,000. While limitation of liability clauses are generally enforceable, severely limiting liability, especially for gross negligence or willful misconduct, can be deemed unconscionable and unenforceable under Pennsylvania and California law. By reducing the cap to such a small amount, the contract introduces legal risk as it could be argued that the clause is unfair and violates public policy, particularly if it leaves a party without meaningful recourse for significant damages caused by the other party's actions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Pennsylvania's and California's laws and regulations regarding contractual limitations of liability and unconscionability.
